answers.answer: I am 32 +5 and up.38 pounds but you can't tell because im all belly. It makes me nervous because my hubby is a health nut and hes teasing already about making me work out when he gets back from deployment.
I gained 53 lbs during my pregnancy and so far I've lost 118 after 10 days

I know how you feel with my first I had him at 39 weeks and had gained 49 pounds but with this pregnancy I'm doing a lot better I'm 30+3 and have only gained 23 pounds if this is your first baby it's normal to gain a lot
Ya this is my first baby. I plan on breastfeeding so hopefully that will help take some of the weight off.
I'm a ftm, I'll be 37 weeks on Wednesday and I've gained about 50lbs... I'm hoping a lot of it is water weight because I swell really, really bad... :/
40 is not a lot! Your doing great. Your supposed to gain weight. 40 is not hugely excessive. I have women tell me all the time they gained 60 70 lbs when pregnant. Now that's a lot of weight.
Yeah I breastfed my son after I had him he was only 5 months old when I got pregnant with this baby and I had lost all the weight except for 13 pounds
40 lbs is normal. I gained that much with my first.

With my first pregnancy I gained 47lbs but I was underweight at 104 so I didn't worry to much about it after breastfeeding I lost weight this time around I'm I'm 33w and have gained 28lbs probably gain some more before my little one is here, I get depressed about it now and then but it's worth it, don't worry I'm sure you else it when your little one is here :)
60lbs my first pregnancy. I also had preeclampsia that made me gain 7 to 8lbs a week toward the end.

question: So I am 38+1 due in 13 days and have gained about 40lbs. I just feel huge all the time now, its pretty depressing especially since I lost over 40lbs about 6 months before getting pregnant. I know some people are going to say its part of being pregnant which I totally understand, but knowing that doesn't exactly make me feel any better..
title: Who else has gained a lot of weight??
